Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Initial Appearance as to Arnaldo Torres-Mendoza held on 9/29/2009. Present AUSA Jose Capo, Myriam Fernandez and USPO Zulma Basora. Defendant was interviewed by the Pretrial Services Officer. Defendant will be represented by a member of the CJA Panel by order of Judge Dominguez. Government requested temporary detention. Defendant remain under custody. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Mariana Bauza and for defendant, Jose F. Blanco. Defendant is present in Court and is (U/C).Arraignment & Bail Hearing as to Luis A.  Hernandez-Arriaga (29) Count 1,2,3,4,5,7 held on 10/20/2009. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and enters a PONG as to all counts. The case is to be referred to Judge Dominguez for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel is heard and states that defendant can live at his uncles house in Villalba. Counsel for the Government is heard and states that it does not oppose bail as long as the Court imposes an amount of cash or secured bond. Further arguments by counsel are heard. The Court after hearing arguments of counsel states that it will grant bail but at this moment it is denying defendant's uncles house to live. Defendant cannot reside at housing or residence of his uncle, without prejudice. The Court will adopt the Pretrial Report, bail is set in the amount of $5,000.00 cash or secured. Defendant cannot enter any of the areas mention in the indictment, that is, the Maximino Miranda Public Housing Project, Enudio Negron Public Housing Project and the Chino Ward, which are located in the Municipality of Villalba. Defendant shall participate in a program of inpatient or outpatient substance abuse treatment program & submit to any method of testing as deemed necessary by the Pretrial Services Office. All Standard Conditions of Release shall apply. Defense counsel inquires as to the bond to be paid by a bonding company, which the Court denies. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Hilda  Gutierrez. )Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:33.Hearing ended at 01:58. (mn) (Entered: 10/21/2009)

ORDER denying 372 Motion for Medical Treatment as to Harry Cartagena-Marrero (20). The defendant is urged to inquire about a "fast track" exhaustion for medical reasons as suggested by the First Circuit Court of Appeals. Acosta v. U. S. Marshals Service, 445 F.3d 509 (1st Cir. 2006). Hence, medical conditions constitute "prison terms" that generally are to be exhausted except if the matter is life threatening. The petition of the defendant is DENIED. Signed by Judge Daniel R. Dominguez on 3/4/2010. (om) (Entered: 03/04/2010)

ORDER denying as to Jose E. Marrero-Gonzalez (By Order of the Court) re 1396 MOTION for Retroactive Application of Sentencing Guidelines to Crack Cocaine Offense 18 USC 3582 filed by Jose E. Marrero-Gonzalez . By Order of the Court: In view of the recommendation of the United States Probation Officer (Docket No. 1411) in relation to defendant Jose Marrero-Gonzalezs motion for retroactive application of Sentencing Guidelines as to crack cocaine, and reduction of sentence pursuant to U.S.S.G. Sec. 1B1.10 as amended and 18 U.S.C. 3582(c)(2)(Docket No. 1396), and there being no opposition to the recommendation of the U.S. Probation Officer, said recommendation is adopted and the motion for retroactive application of Sentencing Guidelines is Denied. Petitioner clearly does not qualify for sentence reduction since his conviction was based upon possession of cocaine and NOT cocaine base. Signed by U.S. Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas on 2/8/2013.(Arenas, Justo) (Entered: 02/08/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Daniel R. Dominguez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jimmy Torres-Rentas (24) held on 11/30/2015. Present were: AUSA Cesar Rivera, AFPD Joannie Plaza and USPO Aida Rivera. Defendant present U/C and assisted by the court interpreter. Defense counsel advised that defendant will not contest the allegations found in the motion filed by U.S. Probation. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment were heard on behalf of defendant. After having heard the parties, the Court finds that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release. Therefore, supervised release term previously imposed is revoked. IMPR: Time Served; SRT: Three (3) Months to be served in an in-patient treatment facility. Defendant was advised his right to appeal. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Further Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Jimmy Torres-Rentas (24) held on 5/5/2016. Present were AUSA Marie Christine Amy, AFPD Joannie Plaza and USPO Alejandro Martinez. The defendant was O/B, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Arguments by defense counsel Plaza on behalf of the defendant were heard. Defendant's exhibits A through C were presented and admitted into evidence. The Government moved the Court to find probable cause as to the alleged violations of supervised release. Government's exhibit 1 was presented and admitted into evidence. After considering the proffer made by the parties, the exhibits and the testimony of USPO, the Court did not find probable cause as to the allegations in 1550 Informative Motion Notifying Violations of Supervision Conditions filed by US Probation Officer Martinez. The Court found that defendant's conduct involved GuaraBi regulation violations. Therefore, probable cause was not found. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Giselle Lopez- Soler:Initial Appearance on Revocation of Supervised Release and Bail Hearing as to Julio Torres-Cortez (6) held on 4/30/2021via VTC. Present were AFPD Kevin Lerman, AUSA Juan Reyes and USPO Grace Moringlane. Defendant was present under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant waived his right to appear physically at the hearing and consented to proceed via VTC. Defendant was advised of the SRT violations as alleged in the motion filed at Docket No. 1770 and as to his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether the supervised release conditions had been violated. Upon the defendant's request, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendant will be represented by the FPD's Office. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant(s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendants] or tends to cast doubt on the United States case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. As to Detention, AFPD Kevin Lerman requested conditions of release. The Government argued for detention. Arguments of USPO Moringlane were also heard. The matter of bail was taken under advisement. Order to be issued. A Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 5/11/2021 at 3:00 PM via VTC Bridge GLS before US Magistrate Judge Giselle Lopez-Soler. (Court Reporter DCR/ ZoomGov Recording.) Hearing held at 11:00. Hearing ended at 11:50. Interpreter Carlos Ravelo. (mig) Modified on 4/30/2021 to edit docket text (rom). (Entered: 04/30/2021)
